subject: Beloved One,
body:
Beloved One,
 
 
My name is Mrs. Sellers Hui, I got your email address from an online e-mail Database Directory through the Internet search and it's true we do not know each other but My spirit led me to write you this email.
 
 
I am a dying sick woman and I'm writing from my sickbed, I want to donate US2,400,000, British Pound Sterling, to you for charity Work all over the World especial at this time the world is fighting against this world pandemic called Coronavirus (COVID-19)
 
 
I write to you with heavy tears in my eyes and great sorrow in my heart because my Doctor informed me that It will only take the will of God for me to survive due to my complicated health issues (CANCER).
 
 
Based on this, I want to transfer my inheritance fund of US2,400,000, British Pound Sterling that was deposited by my late husband, I need a faithful and God-fearing person who will use it according to my desire and that of my late husband as we have no child after so many years of our marriage.
 
 
We want you to use the funds for charity causes, while 20% will be kept by you as compensation for taking this responsibility to help mankind, a lot of people are suffering right now in the World because of this COVID-19 and I want you to use this money to help as many people as possible during this difficult moment in the History of the World.
 
 
I will wait to hear from you to know if you can handle this task with honesty and in good faith.
 
 
Warm wishes.
 
 
Mrs. Sellers Hui
 
E-Mail: 
sellershui88@gmail.com

subject: Re: Beloved One,
body:
Hello Mrs. Sellers Hui,

I'm deeply moved by your message and the situation you're currently in. It's indeed a challenging time for everyone around the world, and your intention to help others is truly commendable.

I'm curious about how you found my email address and why you chose me for this noble cause. I'd also like to know more about the charity work that you have in mind. Are there any specific causes or organizations that you want this money to go towards?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Nancy
